notesStmt.note: Water damage, all repaired/infilled before rebinding. Tidemark at head throughout. Ink burn-through, also flaked off in some heavily inked areas.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A collection of astrological, kabbalistic and magical fragments.

msItem.title: Sefer ma῾alot ha-mazalot ספר מעלות המזלות
Sefer Mafteaḥ Shelomoh ספר מפתח שלמה

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive and square script of the 17th to 18th century.

decoDesc.decoNote:
1r
Full-page drawing of an astrologer, in black ink.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Sepher Hal-Lebanah. Hebr. Brit. Mus. Oriental 6360.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Raffalovich & Lifkin: purchased by the British Museum on 15 April 1902: inscribed, folio [20v].
